definitions.definition: To grow taller rapidly.
To fire many bullets at.
Or To inject (a drug) intravenously.
A long loose outer garment, often signifying honorary stature.
The skin of an animal, especially the bison, dressed with the fur on, and used as a wrap.
A wardrobe, especially one built into a bedroom.
The largest and strongest tobacco leaves.
To clothe; to dress.
To put on official vestments.
Sportive; lively; joyful.
(hunting, fishing, etc.) Of or pertaining to game.
In a game or plucky manner; in a willing and spirited fashion.

A carousel; a pleasure ride, typically found at fairs and amusement parks, consisting of a slowly revolving circular platform on which various seats are fixed, frequently shaped like horses or other animals.
A piece of playground equipment consisting of a circular platform that is made to revolve by pushing while users stand on it.
A meaningless cycle; a bustle of activity that gets nowhere
A freight train of hopper goods wagons which loads and unloads its cargo while moving.
Kind; gentle; mild.
(of a climate or environment) mild and favorable
(in combination) Not harmful to the environment.
definitions.example: an ozone-benign refrigerant

definitions.definition: Not posing any serious threat to health; not particularly aggressive or recurrent.
Commanding respect because of age, dignity, character or position.
Worthy of reverence.
Ancient, antiquated or archaic.
Made sacred especially by religious or historical association.
Giving an impression of aged goodness and benevolence.
A centre-back.
A muscle whose contraction extends or straightens a limb or body part.
A natural substance that is used to make the ground more suitable for growing plants.
A chemical compound created to have the same effect.

Consisting of separate modules; especially where each module performs or fulfills some specified function and could be replaced by a similar module for the same function, independently of the other modules.
Of or relating to a module or modules.
Relating to mode or modulation.
One who performs appraisals.
A strong beef broth.
To shrivel, droop or dry up, especially from lack of water.
To cause to shrivel or dry up.
To lose vigour or power; to languish; to pass away.
To become helpless due to emotion.
To make helpless due to emotion.
Against, in opposition to.
To go against, resist; oppose.
An insulating hat with one or more decorative pieces of spherical fluff at the peak.
A knife for cutting and serving fish at table.
A table knife with spatula-shaped blade designed for eating fish.
To add weight to something; to make something heavier.
To load, burden or oppress someone.
To assign weights to individual statistics.
To bias something; to slant.
To handicap a horse with a specified weight.
To give a certain amount of force to a throw, kick, hit, etc.
The weight or significance given to something, sometimes by means of a statistical multiplier.
definitions.example: Higher weightings were assigned to data from double-blind studies.

definitions.definition: A devotee.
A devotional composition, or part of a composition; devotion.
Devoted to religion or to religious feelings and duties; pious; extremely religious.
Expressing devotion or piety.
definitions.example: devout sighs; devout eyes; a devout posture

definitions.definition: Warmly devoted; hearty; sincere; earnest.
definitions.example: devout wishes for one's welfare

definitions.definition: A religious minister (often a Christian priest or minister) who devotes a large portion of his or her ministry to television broadcasts to a regular viewing audience.
The chief of police of most territorial UK police forces, except the Metropolitan Police and City of London Police.
Reliant upon oneself; trusting to one's own powers or judgment.
To argue to a conclusion or resolution.
definitions.example: We had out our differences and in the end shook hands.

definitions.definition: Someone who is detained, especially in custody or confinement.
A pith helmet
A collective ensemble of eating and serving utensils such as knives, forks and spoons.
The business of a cutler.
The act of providing approval and support; backing; championship.
definitions.example: His vigorous patronage of the conservatives got him in trouble with progressives.

definitions.definition: Customers collectively; clientele; business.
definitions.example: The restaurant had an upper-class patronage.

definitions.definition: A communication that indicates lack of respect by patronizing the recipient; condescension; disdain.
Granting favours or giving contracts or making appointments to office in return for political support.
Guardianship, as of a saint; tutelary care.
The right of nomination to political office.
The right of presentation to church or ecclesiastical benefice; advowson.
To support by being a patron of.
To be a regular customer or client of; to patronize
A person opposed to a concept or principle.
Opposed to something.
That has a torsion angle between 90° and 180°
Alternative form of anti-
Relating to electromagnetism

The natural circulation of nitrogen, in which atmospheric nitrogen is converted to nitrogen oxides by lightning and deposited in the soil by rain, where it is assimilated by plants and either eaten by animals (and returned as faeces) or decomposed back to elemental nitrogen by bacteria.
Opposition or repugnance of mind; fixed dislike.
definitions.example: Due to her aversion to the outdoors she complained throughout the entire camping trip.

definitions.definition: An object of dislike or repugnance.
definitions.example: Pushy salespeople are a major aversion of mine.

definitions.definition: The act of turning away from an object.
To fall one drop at a time.
definitions.example: Listening to the tap next door drip all night drove me mad!

definitions.definition: To leak slowly.
definitions.example: Does the sink drip, or have I just spilt water over the floor?

definitions.definition: To let fall in drops.
definitions.example: After putting oil on the side of the salad, the chef should drip a little vinegar in the oil.

definitions.definition: (usually with with) To have a superabundance of valuable things.
definitions.example: The Old Hall simply drips with masterpieces of the Flemish painters.

definitions.definition: (of the weather) To rain lightly.
definitions.example: The weather isn't so bad. I mean, it's dripping, but you're not going to get so wet.

definitions.definition: To be wet, to be soaked.
To whine or complain consistently; to grumble.
Solid animal fat, traditionally collected from dripping off roasting meat.
The sound or action of something that drips.
definitions.example: Lying in bed, I could hear drippings from the leaky roof.

definitions.definition: The use of a drip tip to drip e-liquid directly onto the atomizer of an e-cigarette.
A place where foreign currency can be exchanged.
Any of the Old World mammals of the family Bovidae, such as the Cape buffalo, Syncerus caffer, or the water buffalo Bubalus bubalis.
A related North American animal, the American bison, Bison bison.
A buffalo robe.
The buffalo fish.
To hunt buffalo.
To outwit, confuse, deceive, or intimidate.
To pistol-whip.
Taking place outside marriage.
Adulterous.
A collision between a bird and an aircraft, especially one that causes an accident.
Someone who rings, especially a bell ringer.
A crowbar.
(games) In the game of horseshoes, the event of the horseshoe landing around the pole.
(games) A game of marbles where players attempt to knock each other's marbles out of a ring drawn on the ground.
A ringer T-shirt.
A person highly proficient at a skill or sport who is brought in, often fraudulently, to supplement a team.
A horse fraudulently entered in a race using the name of another horse.
A person, animal, or entity which resembles another so closely as to be taken for the other, now usually in the phrase dead ringer.
A fraudulently cloned motor vehicle.
A top performer.
The champion shearer of a shearing shed.
A stockman, a cowboy.
Any person or thing that is fraudulent; a fake or impostor.
(in combination) An officer having the specified number of rings (denoting rank) on the uniform sleeve.
The state of being reversed.
An instance of reversing.
A change in fortune; a change from being successful to having problems.
Intended to reverse; implying reversal.
A person or company that owns a vineyard and produces wine.
An extremely large tanker ship.
Beeswax.
Earwax.
definitions.example: What role does the wax in your earhole fulfill?

definitions.definition: Any oily, water-resistant substance; normally long-chain hydrocarbons, alcohols or esters.
Any preparation containing wax, used as a polish.
The phonograph record format for music.
A thick syrup made by boiling down the sap of the sugar maple and then cooling it.
A type of drugs with as main ingredients weed oil and butane; hash oil
Made of wax.
To apply wax to (something, such as a shoe, a floor, a car, or an apple), usually to make it shiny.
To remove hair at the roots from (a part of the body) by coating the skin with a film of wax that is then pulled away sharply.
To defeat utterly.
To kill, especially to murder a person.
(usually of a musical or oral performance) To record.
The process of growing.
To increasingly assume the specified characteristic.
To grow.
(of the moon) To appear larger each night as a progression from a new moon to a full moon.
(of the tide) To move from low tide to high tide.
An outburst of anger.
A union or alliance of states or political organizations.
The act of forming an alliance.

A form of social protest, involving the active but non-violent refusal to obey certain laws, demands, or commands of an established authority, because they are considered to be morally wrong or detrimental.
A bright green, biennial herb, Petroselinum crispum, having many cultivars.
The leaves of this plant used in Middle Eastern, European, and American cooking.
(except in matter of course) That is part of ordinary behaviour or custom; customary, natural.
In due course; as a matter of course, as a natural result.
Naturally, as would be expected; for obvious reasons, obviously.
definitions.example: Of course I know that!

definitions.definition: Indicates enthusiastic agreement.
definitions.example: Will you come with me? — Of course!

definitions.definition: An area, such as a suburb, consisting of mean, roughly-constructed dwellings inhabited by poor people.
Reserved and remote; either physically or emotionally distant; standoffish.
At or from a distance, but within view, or at a small distance; apart; away.
Without sympathy; unfavorably.
Away from; clear of.
Any of various colourful passerine birds, the New World orioles from the family Icteridae and the Old World orioles from the family Oriolidae.
A merry frolic; especially, a drinking frolic.
Uninhibited activity.
To engage in a spree.
The act of an athlete starting a race before being signaled to do so.
The act of an offensive player moving across the line of scrimmage prior to the snap.
An attempt at something that does not work, requiring one to start over.
Shame or disgrace.
definitions.example: You have brought dishonour upon the family.

definitions.definition: Lack of honour or integrity.
Failure or refusal of the drawee or intended acceptor of a negotiable instrument, such as a bill of exchange or note, to accept it or, if it is accepted, to pay and retire it.
To bring disgrace upon someone or something; to shame.
definitions.example: You have dishonoured the family.

definitions.definition: To refuse to accept something, such as a cheque; to not honor.
To violate or rape.
Causing nausea; sickening or disgusting.
(sometimes proscribed) Afflicted with nausea; sick.
A significant side glance; a glance expressive of some passion, as malignity, amorousness, etc.; a sly or lecherous look.
An arch or affected glance or cast of countenance.
To look sideways or obliquely; now especially with sexual desire or malicious intent.
To entice with a leer or leers.
The cheek.
The face.
One's appearance; countenance.
Complexion; hue; colour.
Flesh; skin.
The flank or loin.
Empty; unoccupied; clear.
definitions.example: a leer stomach

definitions.definition: Destitute; lacking; wanting.
Faint from lack of food; hungry.
Thin; faint.
Having no load or burden; free; without a rider.
definitions.example: a leer horse

definitions.definition: Lacking sense or seriousness; trifling; frivolous.
definitions.example: leer words

definitions.definition: To teach.
To learn.
A long oven or kiln, often having a moving belt, used for annealing glass.
An undertaker or funeral director.
A jail cell, or a period of incarceration.
definitions.example: He's in lockup for 30 days for drunk and disorderly.

definitions.definition: A storage unit with a door secured by a padlock or deadbolt; a garage
definitions.example: Joe keeps his other car in a lockup downtown.

definitions.definition: A device for locking type into position for printing.
(by extension) A fixed layout involving one or more logos and possibly related text.
The practise of participating in hand-to-hand combat inside of a usually steel cage.
Fineness; beauty.
Ornament; decoration; especially, excessive decoration; showy clothes; jewels.
(ironworking) A charcoal hearth or furnace for the conversion of cast iron into wrought iron, or into iron suitable for puddling.
Any of several small turtles, of the families Emydidae and Geoemydidae, that live in fresh or brackish water.
An accumulation; an increase; a gradual development.
definitions.example: Snow buildup on roads makes for hazardous driving.

definitions.definition: The construction of a composite core to repair a damaged tooth.
A man who works in a bar.
An athletics field event where competitors attempt to jump as far as possible, after taking a run-up; a jump such as one performed in such an event.
To perform a long jump; to compete in the long jump event.
The riding backwards of the board, in the opposite stance.

The act of riding a BMX bicycle backwards and pedalling with the sprocket movement while moving backwards, then turning the bars away from the desired direction and sliding out so as to ride forwards again.
To ride using a fakie stance.
(of a trick) Performed using the fakie stance.
Low moral standards.
A person of low moral standards.
A man who is sexually aggressive or forward with women to the point of causing disgust.
Sleazy material
definitions.example: a tabloid newspaper full of sleaze

definitions.definition: To act or progress in a sleazy manner.
definitions.example: He sleazed his way over to the women at the bar.

definitions.definition: To slander.
The most senior rank for an academic at a university or similar institution, informally also known as "full professor." Abbreviated Prof.
A teacher or faculty member at a college or university regardless of formal rank.
One who professes something, such as a religious doctrine.
A pianist in a saloon, brothel, etc.
The puppeteer who performs a Punch and Judy show; a Punchman.
Total income or cash flow minus expenditures. The money or other benefit a non-governmental organization or individual receives in exchange for products and services sold at an advertised price.
Benefit, positive result obtained.
definitions.example: Reading such an enlightening book on the subject was of much profit to his studies.

definitions.definition: In property law, a nonpossessory interest in land whereby a party is entitled to enter the land of another for the purpose of taking the soil or the substance of the soil (coal, oil, minerals, and in some jurisdictions timber and game).
Related through adoption; more generally, relating to adoption.
definitions.example: My adoptive parents recently got to know my biological parents.

definitions.definition: One of a number of alternative forms of the same gene occupying a given position, or locus, on a chromosome.

An artificial method of preventing sensation, used to eliminate pain without causing loss of vital functions, by the administration of one or more agents which block pain impulses before transmitted to the brain.
The loss or prevention of sensation, as caused by anesthesia, lesion in the nervous system or other physical abnormality.
Warlike in nature; aggressive; hostile.
Showing or having the impulse to be combative.

A meaning of a word or phrase that is suggested or implied, as opposed to a denotation, or literal meaning. A characteristic of words or phrases, or of the contexts that words and phrases are used in.
The attribute or aggregate of attributes connoted by a term, contrasted with denotation.
definitions.example: The two expressions "the morning star" and "the evening star" have different connotations but the same denotation (i.e. the planet Venus).

definitions.definition: Call sign.
A boat especially designed for saving the lives of shipwrecked people or people in distress at sea (either launched from the shore with a crew, or else carried on board a larger ship)
An emergency vehicle carried aboard a spaceship
To rescue; to carry to safety
A diplomat
To make something childproof.
definitions.example: I debated childproofing my house, but decided against, on the basis that any scars or burns would serve as object lessons in restraint.

definitions.definition: Designed to be unable for a child to use, operate, or open.
definitions.example: Because of her arthritis, she always asked not to have childproof caps on her medicine bottles.

definitions.definition: Made safe for children.
definitions.example: They attempted to make the house childproof by covering all sharp corners with soft foam.

definitions.definition: Made safe from children; resistant to damage by children.
definitions.example: After several visits from his darling nephews, Mike's bookshelves were childproof; all breakables and valuable books had been moved out of reach.

definitions.definition: A flat fold; a doubling, as of cloth; a pleat.
definitions.example: a box plait

definitions.definition: A braid, as of hair or straw; a plat.
To fold; to double in narrow folds; to pleat
definitions.example: to plait a ruffle

definitions.definition: To interweave the strands or locks of; to braid
definitions.example: plaiting rope

definitions.definition: Chromium, when used to plate other metals.
The basic structural elements used in a graphical user interface, such as window frames and scroll bars, as opposed to the content.
Handguns (collectively)
To plate with chrome.
To treat with a solution of potassium bichromate, as in dyeing.
A cable or heavy rope used to tow or moor a ship
A biscuit consisting of currants squashed between layers of flaky pastry.
A bright yellow/orange damselfish, of the genus Hypsypops, from the seas of southern California.
A kind of jacket worn by women.
A sixteenth note, drawn as a crotchet with two tails.
A blossom; the flower of a plant; an expanded bud.
Flowers, collectively.
The opening of flowers in general; the state of blossoming or of having the flowers open.
definitions.example: The cherry trees are in bloom.

definitions.definition: A state or time of beauty, freshness, and vigor; an opening to higher perfection, analogous to that of buds into blossoms.
definitions.example: the bloom of youth

definitions.definition: Rosy colour; the flush or glow on a person's cheek.
The delicate, powdery coating upon certain growing or newly-gathered fruits or leaves, as on grapes, plums, etc.
Anything giving an appearance of attractive freshness.
The clouded appearance which varnish sometimes takes upon the surface of a picture.
A yellowish deposit or powdery coating which appears on well-tanned leather.
A bright-hued variety of some minerals.
definitions.example: the rose-red cobalt bloom

definitions.definition: A white area of cocoa butter that forms on the surface of chocolate when warmed and cooled.
An undesirable halo effect that may occur when a very bright region is displayed next to a very dark region of the screen.
To cause to blossom; to make flourish.
To bestow a bloom upon; to make blooming or radiant.
Of a plant, to produce blooms; to open its blooms.
Of a person, business, etc, to flourish; to be in a state of healthful, growing youth and vigour; to show beauty and freshness.
(Cooking) To bring out the flavor of a spice by cooking it in oil.
The spongy mass of metal formed in a furnace by the smelting process.
A fricative.
A vine in the gourd family, Cucumis sativus.
The edible fruit of this plant, having a green rind and crisp white flesh.
Any plant of the labiate genus Thymus, such as the garden thyme, Thymus vulgaris, a warm, pungent aromatic, that is much used to give a relish to seasoning and soups.
(chiefly in the plural) A building for soldiers, especially within a garrison; originally referred to temporary huts, now usually to a permanent structure or set of buildings.
(chiefly in the plural) primitive structure resembling a long shed or barn for (usually temporary) housing or other purposes
(chiefly in the plural) any very plain, monotonous, or ugly large building
A movable roof sliding on four posts, to cover hay, straw, etc.
(usually in the plural) A police station.
To house military personnel; to quarter.
To live in barracks.
To jeer and heckle; to attempt to disconcert by verbal means.
To cheer for or support a team.
A group of buildings used by military personnel as housing.
To release, especially in large quantities and chaotic manner.
To discard; to get rid of something one does not want anymore.
To sell below cost or very cheaply; to engage in dumping.
To copy data from a system to another place or system, usually in order to archive it.
To output the contents of storage or a data structure, often in order to diagnose a bug.
To end a relationship with.
To knock heavily; to stump.
To put or throw down with more or less of violence; hence, to unload from a cart by tilting it
definitions.example: We dumped the coal onto the fireplace.

definitions.definition: To precipitate (especially snow) heavily.
The disposal of something no longer needed, or of no value.
Selling goods at less than their normal price, especially in the export market as a means of securing a monopoly.
To deliver (someone or something) following a judicial decision.
To devote (oneself) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc.
To bind (a person or thing) to the service of something.
To devote or pledge (oneself) to a given person, cause etc.
To devote (one's mind, talent etc.) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc.
To make (someone) become devoted to a given thing or activity; to cause to be addicted.
Having a biochemical addiction.
Devoted to or obsessed with something.
A maker of wooden furniture or fittings.
A woodworking machine used to prepare edges of wooden elements to join to other wood pieces.
A thing that joins two separate items, e.g. software to connect video or music clips.
A person who joins societies or organizations.
A rainy period
Of, pertaining to, or produced by rain
Occurring through the action of rain
Any of several devices used to loosen or stir the soil, either to remove weeds or to provide aeration and drainage.
A person who cultivates.
